skill.name: cellxgene-census
skill.description: Query CZ CELLxGENE Census (61M+ cells). Filter by cell type/tissue/disease, retrieve expression data, integrate with scanpy/PyTorch, for population-scale single-cell analysis.
skill.summary: Query CZ CELLxGENE Census (61M+ cells). Filter by cell type/tissue/disease, retrieve expression data...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This skill is documentation and usage guidance only. No executable code, filesystem access, or network calls are present in the repository. No suspicious patterns were found.

content.value_statement: Finding relevant single cell data across millions of cells is slow and error prone. This skill guides precise Census queries and scalable analysis workflows.
actual_capabilities: Open specific Census versions with context manager patterns
Query cell and gene metadata with value filters
Load AnnData for small to medium expression queries
Process large expression matrices with axis_query batches
Create PyTorch dataloaders for model training
limitations: Requires the cellxgene-census Python package and dependencies
Only covers human and mouse datasets in the Census
Large queries can exceed memory without batching
Results depend on the chosen Census version

use_cases.title: Map tissue cell types
use_cases.description: List cell types in a tissue and estimate counts before deeper analysis.

use_cases.title: Build training dataloaders
use_cases.description: Create PyTorch dataloaders with cell type labels for model training.

use_cases.title: Compare across tissues
use_cases.description: Run consistent filters to compare gene expression across tissues.

prompt_templates.title: List cell types
prompt_templates.prompt: List unique cell types in human lung and include counts. Use is_primary_data == True.

prompt_templates.title: Small AnnData query
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch AnnData for CD4, CD8A, and FOXP3 in T cells from lung. Include disease and donor metadata.

prompt_templates.title: Batch mean expression
prompt_templates.prompt: Compute mean expression for FOXP2 and TBR1 in brain using axis_query batches and primary data filters.

prompt_templates.title: Train dataloader
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PyTorch dataloader for liver cells with cell_type labels, batch size 128, and shuffle enabled.

output_examples.input: Show main brain cell types and counts from primary data.
output: Filter used: tissue_general == brain and is_primary_data == True

best_practices: Include is_primary_data == True in most filters
Specify a Census version for reproducibility
Estimate query size before loading AnnData
anti_patterns: Loading large datasets without axis_query batching
Omitting the context manager when opening the Census
Querying broad tissues without limiting columns

faq.question: Is this compatible with my environment?
faq.answer: It works with Python environments that can install cellxgene-census and its dependencies.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Large queries can exceed memory without batching and only human and mouse data are available.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides patterns for scanpy and PyTorch workflows.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No. The skill only provides guidance for querying the public Census dataset.

faq.question: What if my query returns too many cells?
faq.answer: Add stricter filters or switch to axis_query for batch processing.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic dataset search?
faq.answer: It targets the Census schema and query syntax for precise, scalable single cell analysis.
